title: Roland Barthes 'The Pleasure of the Text' cover typeface
author: lapvance

comments.content:
Reminds me of Lectura, a design by Dick Dooijes, Amsterdam Foundry, circa 1966. Letraset sold a version as a contact transfer from Tetterode. Character set is in the old Letraset product catalog.  
A much thicker and more conventional version by Paul Hickson is available in digital format as Leighton from Red Rooster [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/leighton-rr/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413075147/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/leighton-rr/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/leighton-rr/")  
Don

The resemblance to Lectura is only approximate. Here is a character set

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413075147im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Lectura1966_5756.png)
  
Compare to this better quality image of the book cover, which was published in the early 1970s 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413075147im_/http:/typophile.com/files/BarthesSM_4426.jpg)
  
Still have not spotted a digital font. Perhaps a photolettering font, or lettering?  
Don
That looks like lettering to me: the h in “Barthes” and the one in “the” have quite different ascenders.
